        git-ls-remote - List the heads of a remote repository

        git ls-remote [<options>] <repository>

        The git ls-remote command lists the heads of a remote repository. It is typically used to fetch the list of references from a remote repository.

OPTIONS
        --abbrev=⟨n⟩
                Show ⟨n⟩ hexadecimal digits of the object name instead of the full 40 digits.

                authordate

                committerdate
                        Sort by committer date.
                
                refname
                        Sort by reference name.
                
                taggerdate
                        Sort by tagger date.
                
                version

        --symref
                Show symbolic references (e.g., refs/heads/main) as symbolic names rather than their target.

                Show only the reference name, not the SHA-1 hash.
